intro: Lilaeopsis masonii, commonly known as Mason's sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands or along streams. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Its botanical features make it an important component of riparian ecosystems.
